Hainan] |iso_code = [[ISO 3166-2:CN|CN-HI-04]] |area_code = |website = {{url|www.danzhou.gov.cn}} }} '''Danzhou''' ({{zh|c=儋州 |p=Dānzhōu}}) is a [[prefecture-level city]] in the northwest of the Chinese island [[Provinces of China|province]] of [[Hainan]]. Although [[Administrative divisions of China#Ambiguity of the word "city" in China|called a "city"]], Danzhou administers a large area which was called '''Dan County''' or '''Danxian''' ({{lang|zh-hans|儋县}}) until 1993. The administrative seat and urban center of Danzhou is [[Nada, Hainan|Nada Town]], which is often colloquially referred to as Danzhou city. Danzhou was upgraded from a county-level city into a prefecture-level city in February 2015. ==History== What is now Danzhou was firstly named Danzhou (儋州) during the [[Song Dynasty]] in the 12th century and only renamed to Danxian in 1912 after hundreds of years, but later re-obtained its name Danzhou after the Communist takeover in the 1950s. During World War 2, Danzhou was among the top most devastated counties in Hainan as the Japanese had massacred more than 30,000 people in Danzhou, destroying over than 10,000 houses and 300 Danzhou villages.[http://www.dzsggw.org/News/Show.asp?id=601] == Subdivisions == Danzhou is a [[prefecture-level city]] of the [[Hainan]] [[Provinces of China|province]]. An uncommon administrative feature is that it has no [[County (People's Republic of China)|county-level]] division. The city government directly administers over 17 [[Towns of the People's Republic of China|towns]] ({{zh|s={{linktext|镇}} |p=zhèn |labels=no}}), one state-run institute, and four state-run farms plus an economic development zone: {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%;" !colspan="9"| Map |- |colspan="9"|
{{Image label begin|image=Administrative Division Danzhou.png|width=450|link=}} {{Image label|x=540|y=320|scale=450/750|text=[[Nada, Hainan|'''Nada''']]}} {{Image label|x=640|y=360|scale=450/750|text=[[Heqing, Hainan|'''Heqing''']]}} {{Image label|x=550|y=500|scale=450/750|text=[[Nanfeng, Hainan|'''Nanfeng''']]}} {{Image label|x=410|y=360|scale=450/750|text=[[Dacheng, Hainan|'''Dacheng''']]}} {{Image label|x=250|y=380|scale=450/750|text='''[[Yaxing]]'''}} {{Image label|x=640|y=450|scale=450/750|text='''[[Lanyang]]'''}} {{Image label|x=470|y=120|scale=450/750|text='''[[Guangcun]]'''}} {{Image label|x=380|y=120|scale=450/750|text='''[[Mutang]]'''}} {{Image label|x=100|y=380|scale=450/750|text=[[Haitou, Hainan|'''Haitou''']]}} {{Image label|x=320|y=090|scale=450/750|text=[[Eman, Hainan|'''Eman''']]}} {{Image label|x=250|y=150|scale=450/750|text=[[Sandou, Hainan|'''Sandou''']]}} {{Image label|x=325|y=275|scale=450/750|text='''[[Wangwu]]'''}} {{Image label|x=240|y=240|scale=450/750|text='''[[Baimajing]]'''}} {{Image label|x=370|y=170|scale=450/750|text=[[Zhonghe, Hainan|'''Zhonghe''']]}} {{Image label|x=200|y=300|scale=450/750|text='''[[Paipu]]'''}} {{Image label|x=450|y=230|scale=450/750|text=[[Dongcheng, Hainan|'''Dongcheng''']]}} {{Image label|x=325|y=210|scale=450/750|text=[[Xinzhou, Hainan|'''Xingzhou''']]}}

|} {{reflist|group=n}} == Demographics == The city's population was {{formatnum:932,362}} in 2010. The Han population is 857,342 and the minority population is 75,020.{{cite web |trans-title=Danzhou Sixth Population Census Data Bulletin |url=http://www.danzhou.gov.cn/dzgov/zwgk/tjgb/201105/t20110530_536854.html |script-title=zh:儋州市第六次人口普查主要数据公报 |language=zh-hans |access-date=15 April 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130522052841/http://www.danzhou.gov.cn/dzgov/zwgk/tjgb/201105/t20110530_536854.html |archive-date=22 May 2013 |url-status=dead }} ==Language== The Danzhou natives speak the Yue [[Danzhou dialect]], unlike the [[Min Chinese|Min]] [[Hainanese]] language that is spoken throughout most of eastern Hainan. ==Transportation== The area will be served by [[Danzhou Airport]], an under-construction airport approximately {{convert|25|km|abbr=on}} northeast of Nada.http://www.boulter.com/gps/distance/?from=19.696709%2C+109.727247&to=19.51874%2C+109.572238&units=k It will be international-class, built to handle the increasing number of tourists visiting the area. The airport is scheduled for completion in 2015.http://centreforaviation.com/profiles/newairports/danzhou-airport{{Cite web |url=http://www.whatsonsanya.com/sanya-travel-2213.html |title=Archived copy |access-date=29 December 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160215195650/http://www.whatsonsanya.com/sanya-travel-2213.html |archive-date=15 February 2016 |url-status=dead }}{{cite web | url=http://www.danzhou.gov.cn/dzgov/ywdt/jrdz/201212/t20121219_846954.html | title=儋州机场选址初定梅花岭 张琦严朝君出席会议并讲话 | trans-title=Zhangzhou Airport Site Selected at Zhangzhou Meihualing - Zhang Qi Yan Chaojun attended the meeting and delivered a speech | date=19 December 2012 | publisher=Danzhou Municipal People's Government, Hainan Province | accessdate=21 July 2018 }} The [[Hainan Western Ring High-Speed Railway]] also provides access. ==Climate== {{Weather box|width=auto |metric first=y |single line=y |collapsed = Y |location = Danzhou (1981−2010) |Jan high C = 22.9 |Feb high C = 24.3 |Mar high C =
